nodes.name: subject
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific patient, case, or subject in the context of a specific dataset or experiment.

properties.name: age_at_index
properties.description: The study participant's age, in years, at the index event. The index event is determined by the data submitter and used as an anchor date for all temporal variables. Note that an age of 0 indicates a participant who is younger than 1 year old. For participants with ages greater than 89 years, please use the property 'age_at_index_gt89'.

properties.name: age_at_index_gt89
properties.description: Indicates whether the subject's age at the time of the study was greater than 89 years.

properties.name: cause_of_death
properties.description: Text term to identify the cause of patient death with respect to cancer.

properties.name: country_of_residence
properties.description: The country where the subject resides.

properties.name: days_to_birth
properties.description: The number of days between the index date and the date of patient birth. If the number of days is greater than 32872 (89 years), then please use 'days_to_birth_gt89'.

properties.name: days_to_birth_gt89
properties.description: Indicate if the number of days between the index date and the date of patient birth is greater than 32872 (89 years).

properties.name: days_to_death
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the date the subject was deceased.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: index_event
properties.description: The event used as the anchor or start date for all temporal data elements. This acts as day 0 on a timeline of events relating to the patient.

properties.name: race
properties.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: A de-identified code used to classify a case as part of a specific data submission.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

properties.name: zip
properties.description: The three-digit United States zip code of residence for any population greater than 20,000. For zip codes where the three digit number represents a population less than 20,000 "000" will be provided.

properties.name: file_name

properties.name: file_size

properties.name: file_url

properties.name: md5sum

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_m
properties.description: Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_n
properties.description: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_stage
properties.description: Stage group determined from clinical information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for cancer.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_t
properties.description: Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_m
properties.description: Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_n
properties.description: The codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_t
properties.description: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: best_overall_response

properties.name: cimt_2
properties.description: Common carotid intima-media thickness, calculated as the mean of four values: maximum of multiple thickness estimates from the left far wall, left near wall, right far wall, and right near wall. (mm) (HARMONIZED)

properties.name: classification_of_tumor
properties.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

properties.name: comorbidity
properties.description: Text term to identify a coexistent disease or condition in a person.

properties.name: condition_code
properties.description: The code for a specific codition, assigned by the code system.

properties.name: condition_code_system
properties.description: The system that assigned the code for a specific condition.

properties.name: condition_concept_id
properties.description: The CONDITION_CONCEPT_ID field is recommended for primary use in analyses, and must be used for network studies. This is the standard concept mapped from the source value which represents a condition The CONCEPT_ID that the CONDITION_SOURCE_VALUE maps to. Only records whose source values map to concepts with a domain of “Condition” should go in this table. Accepted Concepts.

properties.name: condition_name
properties.description: The name of the condition the patient has experienced.

properties.name: condition_source_concept_id
properties.description: This is the concept representing the condition source value and may not necessarily be standard. This field is discouraged from use in analysis because it is not required to contain Standard Concepts that are used across the OHDSI community, and should only be used when Standard Concepts do not adequately represent the source detail for the Condition necessary for a given analytic use case. Consider using CONDITION_CONCEPT_ID instead to enable standardized analytics that can be consistent across the network. If the CONDITION_SOURCE_VALUE is coded in the source data using an OMOP supported vocabulary put the concept id representing the source value here.

properties.name: condition_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the condition that occurred. For example, this could be an ICD10 or Read code. This code is mapped to a Standard Condition Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

properties.name: condition_status_concept_id
properties.description: This concept represents the point during the visit the diagnosis was given (admitting diagnosis, final diagnosis), whether the diagnosis was determined due to laboratory findings, if the diagnosis was exclusionary, or if it was a preliminary diagnosis, among others. Choose the Concept in the Condition Status domain that best represents the point during the visit when the diagnosis was given. These can include admitting diagnosis, principal diagnosis, and secondary diagnosis. Accepted Concepts.

properties.name: condition_status_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the condition status. This information may be called something different in the source data but the field is meant to contain a value indicating when and how a diagnosis was given to a patient. This source value is mapped to a standard concept which is stored in the CONDITION_STATUS_CONCEPT_ID field.

properties.name: condition_type_concept_id
properties.description: This field can be used to determine the provenance of the Condition record, as in whether the condition was from an EHR system, insurance claim, registry, or other sources. Choose the CONDITION_TYPE_CONCEPT_ID that best represents the provenance of the record. Accepted Concepts. A more detailed explanation of each Type Concept can be found on the vocabulary wiki.

properties.name: coronary_artery_disease

properties.name: covid19_positive
properties.description: An indicator of whether the patient has ever had a positive COVID-19 test or been diagnosed with one of the following ICD-10 COVID-19 conditions: COVID-19 (U07. 1), Influenza due to unidentified influenza virus with other manifestations (J11.8), Post COVID-19 condition (U09.9), Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (G93.32), or Sequelae of other specified infectious and parasitic diseases (B94.8). For more information about a patient's specific COVID-19 diagnosis, details can be found under Condition.

properties.name: covid_hospital_admission
properties.description: Did COVID-19 contribute to need for hospital admission?

properties.name: covid_hospital_admission_age
properties.description: Age on hospital admit (years, age ≥1 year)

properties.name: covid_icu
properties.description: Was patient admitted to ICU during hospitalization?

properties.name: covid_icu_stay_length
properties.description: Total ICU length of stay (from hospital admit)

properties.name: covid_pos_ever_yn
properties.description: Any positive COVID-19 test?

properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the subject no longer experienced the condition.

properties.name: days_to_condition_start
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the subject was diagnosed with or began experiencing the condition.

properties.description: Reported Emphysema in the participant (HARMONIZED)

properties.name: heart_failure

properties.description: Reported Hyperlipidemia condition in the participant (HARMONIZED)

properties.name: hypertension
properties.description: Reported Hypertension condition in the participant (HARMONIZED)

properties.name: icu_indicator
properties.description: Indicates whether the subject has been admitted to the ICU.

properties.name: long_covid_diagnosis
properties.description: An indicator of whether the patient has ever been diagnosed with one of the following ICD-10 long COVID-19 conditions: U09.9 (Post COVID-19 condition, unspecified), G93.32 (Myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome), and B94.8 (Sequelae of other specified infectious and parasitic diseases).  'Positive' means the patient was diagnosed with a long COVID condition, while 'Not Reported' means the patient has never been diagnosed with a long COVID condition.

properties.name: method_of_diagnosis
properties.description: The method used to initially the patient's diagnosis.

properties.name: morphology
properties.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

properties.name: myocardial_infarction
properties.description: Reported Myocardial Infarction in the participant (HARMONIZED)

properties.name: overall_survival
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the patient's date of death or the date the patient was last known to be alive.

properties.name: primary_diagnosis
properties.description: The primary disease, disorder, or condition the patient was diagnosed with.

properties.name: prior_malignancy
properties.description: Text term to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis and the spatial location of any previous cancer occurrence.

properties.name: prior_treatment
properties.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

properties.name: progression_free_survival
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the first date the patient is known to be free of disease progression.

properties.name: progression_free_survival_event
properties.description: The event used to define the patient's disease progression.

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: The provider associated with condition record, e.g. the provider who made the diagnosis or the provider who recorded the symptom. The ETL may need to make a choice as to which PROVIDER_ID to put here. Based on what is available this may or may not be different than the provider associated with the overall VISIT_OCCURRENCE record, for example the admitting vs attending physician on an EHR record.

properties.name: residual_disease
properties.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: The site ID.

properties.name: stop_reason
properties.description: The Stop Reason indicates why a Condition is no longer valid with respect to the purpose within the source data. Note that a Stop Reason does not necessarily imply that the condition is no longer occurring. This information is often not populated in source data and it is a valid etl choice to leave it blank if the information does not exist.

properties.name: tumor_grade

nodes.name: device_exposure
nodes.description: The device exposure domain captures information about a person's exposure to a foreign physical object or instrument that which is used for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes through a mechanism beyond chemical action. Devices include implantable objects (e.g. pacemakers, stents, artificial joints), medical equipment and supplies (e.g. bandages, crutches, syringes), other instruments used in medical procedures (e.g. sutures, defibrillators) and material used in clinical care (e.g. adhesives, body material, dental material, surgical material).

properties.name: days_to_device_exposure_end
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the end of device exposure.

properties.name: days_to_device_exposure_start
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the start of device exposure.

properties.name: device_concept_id
properties.description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the Device concept.

properties.name: device_source_concept_id
properties.description: A foreign key to a Device Concept that refers to the code used in the source.

properties.name: device_source_value
properties.description: The source code for the Device as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard Device Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

properties.name: device_type_concept_id
properties.description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the type of Device Exposure recorded. It indicates how the Device Exposure was represented in the source data.

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: A foreign key to the provider in the PROVIDER table who initiated of administered the Device.

properties.name: quantity
properties.description: The number of individual Devices used for the exposure.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: The site ID.

properties.name: unique_device_id
properties.description: A UDI or equivalent identifying the instance of the Device used in the Person.

properties.name: visit_id
properties.description: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT table during which the device was used.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'device_exposure' table.

properties.name: device_exposure.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'device_exposure' table.

nodes.name: drug_exposure
nodes.description: The drug exposure domain captures records about the utilization of a Drug when ingested or otherwise introduced into the body. A Drug is a biochemical substance formulated in such a way that when administered to a Person it will exert a certain physiological effect. Drugs include prescription and over-the-counter medicines, vaccines, and large-molecule biologic therapies. Radiological devices ingested or applied locally do not count as Drugs. Drug Exposure is inferred from clinical events associated with orders, prescriptions written, pharmacy dispensings, procedural administrations, and other patient-reported information. Prescriptions filled at dispensing providers such as pharmacies, and then captured in reimbursement claim systems, Drugs administered as part of a Procedure, such as chemotherapy or vaccines.

properties.name: days_supply
properties.description: The number of days of supply of the medication as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record.

properties.name: days_to_drug_exposure_end

The measurement table contains both orders and results of measurements as laboratory tests, vital signs, quantitative findings from pathology reports, etc. Measurements differ from Observations in that they require a standardized test or some other activity to generate a quantitative or qualitative result.

nodes.name: observation
nodes.description: Clinical facts about a subject obtained in the context of examination, questioning or a procedure. Any data that cannot be represented by any other domains, such as social and lifestyle facts, medical history, family history, etc. are recorded here. Observations differ from Measurements in that they do not require a standardized test or some other activity to generate clinical fact. Typical observations are medical history, family history, the stated need for certain treatment, social circumstances, lifestyle choices, healthcare utilization patterns, etc. If the generation clinical facts requires a standardized testing such as lab testing or imaging and leads to a standardized result, the data item is recorded in the MEASUREMENT table. If the clinical fact observed determines a sign, symptom, diagnosis of a disease or other medical condition, it is recorded in the CONDITION_OCCURRENCE table.

properties.name: adverse_event
properties.description: Text that represents the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events low level term name for an adverse event.

properties.name: age_at_current_smoker_baseline
properties.description: Age in years at measurement of current_smoker_baseline.

properties.name: age_at_ever_smoker_baseline

properties.name: alcohol_intensity
properties.description: Category to describe the patient's current level of alcohol use as self-reported by the patient.

properties.name: bmi
properties.description: The body mass divided by the square of the body height expressed in units of kg/m^2.

properties.name: cause_of_response
properties.description: A specific regimen or line of therapy responsible for the patient's observed improvement achived at a certain point in time during a patient's treatment protocol.

properties.name: cigarettes_per_day

properties.name: current_smoker_baseline

properties.name: days_to_observation

properties.name: disease_response

properties.name: ecog_performance_status
properties.description: The ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.

properties.name: ever_smoker_baseline
properties.description: Indicates whether subject ever regularly smoked cigarettes.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the patient in centimeters.

properties.name: observation_answer
properties.description: The answer or value provided for a specific observation about a subject obtained in the context of examination, questioning or a during procedure.

properties.name: observation_concept_id
properties.description: The OBSERVATION_CONCEPT_ID field is recommended for primary use in analyses, and must be used for network studies. The CONCEPT_ID that the OBSERVATION_SOURCE_CONCEPT_ID maps to. There is no specified domain that the Concepts in this table must adhere to. The only rule is that records with Concepts in the Condition, Procedure, Drug, Measurement, or Device domains MUST go to the corresponding table.

properties.name: observation_name
properties.description: The short name of the observation about the subject obtained in the context of examination, questioning or a during procedure.

properties.name: observation_source_concept_id
properties.description: This is the concept representing the OBSERVATION_SOURCE_VALUE and may not necessarily be standard. This field is discouraged from use in analysis because it is not required to contain Standard Concepts that are used across the OHDSI community, and should only be used when Standard Concepts do not adequately represent the source detail for the Observation necessary for a given analytic use case. Consider using OBSERVATION_CONCEPT_ID instead to enable standardized analytics that can be consistent across the network. If the OBSERVATION_SOURCE_VALUE is coded in the source data using an OMOP supported vocabulary put the concept id representing the source value here.

properties.name: observation_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the Observation that occurred. For example, this could be an ICD10 or Read code. This code is mapped to a Standard Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

properties.name: observation_type_concept_id
properties.description: This field can be used to determine the provenance of the Observation record, as in whether the measurement was from an EHR system, insurance claim, registry, or other sources. Choose the OBSERVATION_TYPE_CONCEPT_ID that best represents the provenance of the record, for example whether it came from an EHR record or billing claim. Accepted Concepts. A more detailed explanation of each Type Concept can be found on the OMOP vocabulary wiki.

properties.name: progression_or_recurrence
properties.description: Indicator to identify whether a patient has had a recurrent or relapsed malignancy or a progression of disease.

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: The provider associated with the observation record, e.g. the provider who ordered the test or the provider who recorded the result. The ETL may need to make a choice as to which PROVIDER_ID to put here. Based on what is available this may or may not be different than the provider associated with the overall VISIT_OCCURRENCE record. For example the admitting vs attending physician on an EHR record.

properties.name: qualifier_concept_id
properties.description: This field contains all attributes specifying the clinical fact further, such as as degrees, severities, drug-drug interaction alerts etc. Use your best judgement as to what Concepts to use here and if they are necessary to accurately represent the clinical record. There is no restriction on the domain of these Concepts, they just need to be Standard.

properties.name: qualifier_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the qualifier of the Observation that occurred. This code is mapped to a Standard Condition Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

properties.name: relationship_age_at_diagnosis_gt89
properties.description: The age (in years) when the patient's relative was first diagnosed.

properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: relationship_primary_diagnosis
properties.description: The primary disease, disorder, or condition the patient was diagnosed with.

properties.name: relationship_type
properties.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.

properties.name: relative_with_cancer_history
properties.description: Indicator to signify whether or not an individual's biological relative has been diagnosed with another type of cancer.

properties.description: The care site ID.

properties.name: time_from_alcohol
properties.description: Hours since the patient last consumed alcohol.

properties.name: time_from_biopsy
properties.description: Hours since the patient last underwent a biopsy; please record the biopsy information in the 'diagnostic_test' node and link that record to this followup record.

properties.name: time_from_exercise
properties.description: Hours since the patient last exercised.

properties.name: time_from_food
properties.description: Hours since the patient last consumed food.

properties.name: time_from_physical_trauma
properties.description: Hours since the patient last experienced physical trauma.

properties.name: time_from_recreational_drugs
properties.description: Hours since the patient last used recreational drugs.

properties.name: time_from_tobacco
properties.description: Hours since the patient last used tobacco.

properties.name: time_from_treatment
properties.description: Hours since the patient received a treatment, including surgical procedures or medications; please record the treatment information in the 'treatment' node and link that record to this followup record.

properties.name: tobacco_smoking_status
properties.description: Subject's tobacco smoking status.

properties.name: unit_concept_id
properties.description: There is currently no recommended unit for individual observation concepts. UNIT_SOURCE_VALUES should be mapped to a Standard Concept in the Unit domain that best represents the unit as given in the source data. There is no standardization requirement for units associated with OBSERVATION_CONCEPT_IDs, however, it is the responsibility of the ETL to choose the most plausible unit. If the source unit is NULL (applicable to cases when there's no numerical value or when it doesn't require a unit), keep unit_concept_id NULL as well. If there's no mapping of a source unit, populate unit_concept_id with 0.

properties.name: unit_current_smoker_baseline
properties.description: Harmonization unit for current_smoker_baseline. A "harmonization unit" is a defined group of subjects whose phenotypes can be similarly processed.

properties.name: unit_ever_smoker_baseline
properties.description: Harmonization unit for ever_smoker_baseline. A "harmonization unit" is a defined group of subjects whose phenotypes can be similarly processed.

properties.name: unit_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the unit of the Observation that occurred. This code is mapped to a Standard Condition Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.

properties.name: value_as_concept_id
properties.description: It is possible that some records destined for the Observation table have two clinical ideas represented in one source code. This is common with ICD10 codes that describe a family history of some Condition, for example. In OMOP the Vocabulary breaks these two clinical ideas into two codes; one becomes the OBSERVATION_CONCEPT_ID and the other becomes the VALUE_AS_CONCEPT_ID. It is important when using the Observation table to keep this possibility in mind and to examine the VALUE_AS_CONCEPT_ID field for relevant information. Note that the value of VALUE_AS_CONCEPT_ID may be provided through mapping from a source Concept which contains the content of the Observation. In those situations, the CONCEPT_RELATIONSHIP table in addition to the 'Maps to' record contains a second record with the relationship_id set to 'Maps to value'. For example, ICD10 Z82.4 'Family history of ischaemic heart disease and other diseases of the circulatory system' has a 'Maps to' relationship to 4167217 'Family history of clinical finding' as well as a 'Maps to value' record to 134057 'Disorder of cardiovascular system'. If there's no categorial result in a source_data, set value_as_concept_id to NULL, if there is a categorial result in a source_data but without mapping, set value_as_concept_id to 0.

properties.name: value_as_number
properties.description: This is the numerical value of the Result of the Observation, if applicable and available. It is not expected that all Observations will have numeric results, rather, this field is here to house values should they exist.

properties.name: value_as_string
properties.description: This is the textual, categorical value of the Result of the Observation, if applicable and available.

properties.name: value_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim result value of the Observation from the source data. Do not get confused with the Observation_source_value which captures source value of the observation mapped to observation_concept_id. This field is the observation result value from the source. If the observation_source_value was a question, for example, or an observation that requires a result then this field is the answer/ result from the source data. Store the verbatim value that represents the result of the observation_source_value.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: The weight of the patient measured in kilograms.

properties.name: years_smoked
properties.description: Numeric value (or unknown) to represent the number of years a person has been smoking.

properties.name: years_smoked_gt89
properties.description: Indicator of whether the number of years smoked is greater than 89 years.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'observation' table.

properties.name: observation.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'observation' table.

nodes.name: payer_plan_period
nodes.description: Captures details of the period of time that a subject or person is continuously enrolled under a specific health Plan benefit structure from a given Payer. Each Person receiving healthcare is typically covered by a health benefit plan, which pays for or provides the care. These benefit plans are provided by payers, such as health insurances or state or government agencies. In each plan the details of the health benefits are defined for the Person or her family, and the health benefit Plan might change over time typically with increasing utilization (reaching certain cost thresholds such as deductibles), plan availability and purchasing choices of the Person. The unique combinations of Payer organizations, health benefit Plans and time periods in which they are valid for a Person are recorded in this table.

properties.name: days_to_payer_plan_period_end
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the end of the payer_plan_period.

properties.name: days_to_payer_plan_period_start
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the start of the payer_plan_period.

properties.name: family_source_value
properties.description: The common identifier for all people (often a family) that covered by the same policy. Often these are the common digits of the enrollment id of the policy members.

properties.name: payer_concept_id
properties.description: This field represents the organization who reimburses the provider which administers care to the Person. Map the payer directly to a standard CONCEPT_ID with the domain_id of 'Payer' (Accepted Concepts). This vocabulary is not exhaustive so if there is a value missing, please see the custom concepts page.

properties.name: payer_plan_period_id
properties.description: A unique identifier for each unique combination of a Person, Payer, Plan, and Period of time.

properties.name: payer_source_concept_id
properties.description: If the source data codes the Payer in an OMOP supported vocabulary store the concept_id here.

properties.name: payer_source_value
properties.description: This is the Payer as it appears in the source data.

properties.name: plan_concept_id
properties.description: This field represents the specific health benefit Plan the Person is enrolled in. Map the Plan directly to a standard CONCEPT_ID in the 'Plan' vocabulary (Accepted Concepts). This vocabulary is not exhaustive so if there is a value missing, please see the custom concepts page.

properties.name: plan_source_concept_id
properties.description: If the source data codes the Plan in an OMOP supported vocabulary store the concept_id here.

properties.name: plan_source_value
properties.description: This is the health benefit Plan of the Person as it appears in the source data.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: The care site ID.

properties.name: sponsor_concept_id
properties.description: This field represents the sponsor of the Plan who finances the Plan. This includes self-insured, small group health plan and large group health plan. Map the sponsor directly to a standard CONCEPT_ID with the domain_id of 'Sponsor' (Accepted Concepts). This vocabulary is not exhaustive so if there is a value missing, please see the custom concepts page.

properties.name: sponsor_source_concept_id
properties.description: If the source data codes the sponsor in an OMOP supported vocabulary store the concept_id here.

properties.name: sponsor_source_value
properties.description: The Plan sponsor as it appears in the source data.

properties.name: stop_reason_concept_id
properties.description: This field represents the reason the Person left the Plan, if known. Map the stop reason directly to a standard CONCEPT_ID with a domain of 'Plan Stop Reason' (Accepted Concepts). If one does not exist visit the Custom Concepts pate for more information.

properties.name: stop_reason_source_concept_id
properties.description: If the source data codes the stop reason in an OMOP supported vocabulary store the concept_id here.

properties.name: stop_reason_source_value
properties.description: The Plan stop reason as it appears in the source data.

properties.name: visit_id
properties.description: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT table during which the device was used.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'payer_plan_period' table.

properties.name: payer_plan_period.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'payer_plan_period' table.

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any biological or material sample used for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample.

properties.name: collection_site
properties.description: Code for BSS collection site. Indicates the site that enrolled the donor,  brain subregions may have more than one site.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

properties.name: current_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the current weight of the sample, measured  in milligrams.

properties.name: freezing_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used for freezing the sample.

properties.name: hours_to_collection
properties.description: Total Ischemic time for a sample

properties.name: hours_to_sample_procurement
properties.description: Time a sample spent in the PAXgene fixative

properties.name: method_of_sample_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: sample_type
properties.description: Original material type of the collected sample

properties.name: specimen_id
properties.description: Unique identifier that can be used to retrieve more information for a specimen.

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: dataset.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'dataset' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: visit
nodes.description: This table contains events where subjects engage with the healthcare system for a duration of time. They are often also called “encounters”. Visits are defined by a configuration of circumstances under which they occur, such as (i) whether the patient comes to a healthcare institution, the other way around, or the interaction is remote, (ii) whether and what kind of trained medical staff is delivering the service during the Visit, and (iii) whether the Visit is transient or for a longer period involving a stay in bed.

properties.name: admitted_from_concept_id
properties.description: Use this field to determine where the patient was admitted from. This concept is part of the visit domain and can indicate if a patient was admitted to the hospital from a long-term care facility, for example. If available, map the admitted_from_source_value to a standard concept in the visit domain. If a person was admitted from home or was self-referred, set this to 0.

properties.name: admitted_from_source_value
properties.description: This information may be called something different in the source data but the field is meant to contain a value indicating where a person was admitted from. Typically this applies only to visits that have a length of stay, like inpatient visits or long-term care visits.

properties.name: days_to_hospital_admission
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's index date and the date of the patient's hospital admission.

properties.name: days_to_hospital_discharge
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's index date and the date of the patient's hospital discharge.

properties.name: days_to_icu_admission
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's index date and the date of the patient's ICU admission.

properties.name: days_to_icu_discharge
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's index date and the date of the patient's ICU discharge..

properties.name: days_to_visit_end
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the end of the visit.

properties.name: days_to_visit_start
properties.description: The difference in days between the subject's index_date and the start of the visit.

properties.name: discharge_type
properties.description: The status or destination of the patient at the time of discharge.

properties.name: discharged_to_concept_id
properties.description: Use this field to determine where the patient was discharged to after a visit. This concept is part of the visit domain and can indicate if a patient was transferred to another hospital or sent to a long-term care facility, for example. It is assumed that a person is discharged to home therefore there is not a standard concept id for “home”. Use concept id = 0 when a person is discharged to home. If available, map the discharged_to_source_value to a standard concept in the visit domain.

properties.name: discharged_to_source_value
properties.description: This information may be called something different in the source data but the field is meant to contain a value indicating where a person was discharged to after a visit, as in they went home or were moved to long-term care. Typically this applies only to visits that have a length of stay of a day or more.

properties.name: preceding_visit_occurrence_id
properties.description: Use this field to find the visit that occurred for the person prior to the given visit. There could be a few days or a few years in between. This field can be used to link a visit immediately preceding the current visit. Note this is not symmetrical, and there is no such thing as a “following_visit_id”.

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: There will only be one provider per visit record and the ETL document should clearly state how they were chosen (attending, admitting, etc.). If there are multiple providers associated with a visit in the source, this can be reflected in the event tables (CONDITION_OCCURRENCE, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE, etc.) or in the VISIT_DETAIL table. If there are multiple providers associated with a visit, you will need to choose which one to put here. The additional providers can be stored in the VISIT_DETAIL table.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: The care site ID.

properties.name: visit_concept_id
properties.description: This field contains a concept id representing the kind of visit, like inpatient or outpatient. All concepts in this field should be standard and belong to the Visit domain. Populate this field based on the kind of visit that took place for the person. For example this could be “Inpatient Visit”, “Outpatient Visit”, “Ambulatory Visit”, etc. This table will contain standard concepts in the Visit domain. These concepts are arranged in a hierarchical structure to facilitate cohort definitions by rolling up to generally familiar Visits adopted in most healthcare systems worldwide.

properties.name: visit_source_concept_id
properties.description: If the visit source value is coded in the source data using an OMOP supported vocabulary put the concept id representing the source value here.

properties.name: visit_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the kind of visit that took place (inpatient, outpatient, emergency, etc.) If there is information about the kind of visit in the source data that value should be stored here. If a visit is an amalgamation of visits from the source then use a hierarchy to choose the visit source value, such as IP -> ER-> OP. This should line up with the logic chosen to determine how visits are created.

properties.name: visit_type_concept_id
properties.description: Use this field to understand the provenance of the visit record, or where the record comes from. Populate this field based on the provenance of the visit record, as in whether it came from an EHR record or billing claim.  A more detailed explanation of each Type Concept can be found on the vocabulary wiki.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'visit' table.

properties.name: visit.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'visit' table.

nodes.name: aliquot
nodes.description: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

properties.name: analyte_type

properties.name: experimental_strategy
properties.description: The sequencing strategy used to generate the data file referred to by the ga4gh_drs_uri.

properties.name: sample.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'sample' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'aliquot' table.

properties.name: aliquot.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'aliquot' table.

properties.name: Contrast

properties.name: Manufacturer
properties.description: (0008, 0070) Manufacturer

properties.description: (0018, 0031) Radiopharmaceutical

properties.name: ReceiveCoilName

properties.description: (0018, 0022) ScanOptions

properties.name: ScanningSequence
properties.description: (0018, 0020) Scanning Sequence

properties.name: SequenceVariant
properties.description: (0018, 0021) Sequence Variant

properties.name: SeriesDescription
properties.description: (0008, 103e) Series Description

properties.name: SeriesInstanceUID
properties.description: (0020, 000e) Series Instance UID

properties.name: SliceThickness
properties.description: (0018, 0050) Slice Thickness

properties.name: SoftwareVersions
properties.description: (0018, 1020) Software Versions

properties.name: TransmitCoilName
properties.description: (0018, 1251) Transmit Coil Name

properties.name: ViewPosition
properties.description: (0018, 5101) Radiographic view associated with (0018, 5100) Patient Position.

properties.name: dicom_viewer_url
properties.description: A URL where the dicom images can be viewed.

properties.name: file_names
properties.description: The file names of any data files associated with this imaging series.

properties.name: file_urls
properties.description: The URLs of any data files associated with this imaging series.

properties.name: object_ids
properties.description: The list of file identifiers (data GUIDs, DRS URIs, or URLs, etc.) for the imaging series, if applicable.

properties.name: series_viewer_url
properties.description: A URL where the imaging series can be viewed.

properties.name: dataset.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'dataset' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'imaging_series' table.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'imaging_series' table.

properties.name: imaging_study.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'imaging_study' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'imaging_series' table.

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'imaging_series' table.

nodes.name: procedure
nodes.description: Records of activities or processes ordered by, or carried out by, a healthcare provider on the patient with a diagnostic or therapeutic purpose.

properties.name: breathing_support_type
properties.description: The type of breathing support the patient received.

properties.name: days_to_procedure_end
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's index date and the end date of the procedure.

properties.name: days_to_procedure_start
properties.description: The number of days between the subject's index date and the start date of the procedure.

properties.name: modifier_concept_id
properties.description: The modifiers are intended to give additional information about the procedure but as of now the vocabulary is under review. It is up to the ETL to choose how to map modifiers if they exist in source data. These concepts are typically distinguished by 'Modifier' concept classes (e.g., 'CPT4 Modifier' as part of the 'CPT4' vocabulary). If there is more than one modifier on a record, one should be chosen that pertains to the procedure rather than provider. Accepted Concepts.

properties.name: modifier_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the modifier code for the procedure that occurred. The value stored here is mapped to a MODIFIER_CONCEPT_ID.

properties.name: procedure_concept_id
properties.description: The PROCEDURE_CONCEPT_ID field is recommended for primary use in analyses, and must be used for network studies. This is the standard concept mapped from the source value which represents a procedure The CONCEPT_ID that the PROCEDURE_SOURCE_VALUE maps to. Only records whose source values map to standard concepts with a domain of “Procedure” should go in this table. Accepted Concepts.

properties.name: procedure_name
properties.description: The textual categorization of the procedure performed.

properties.name: procedure_occurrence_id
properties.description: The unique key given to a procedure record for a person. Refer to the ETL for how duplicate procedures during the same visit were handled. Each instance of a procedure occurrence in the source data should be assigned this unique key. In some subjects, a person can have multiple records of the same procedure within the same visit. It is valid to keep these duplicates and assign them individual, unique, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE_IDs, though it is up to the ETL how they should be handled.

properties.name: procedure_source_concept_id
properties.description: This is the concept representing the procedure source value and may not necessarily be standard. This field is discouraged from use in analysis because it is not required to contain Standard Concepts that are used across the OHDSI community, and should only be used when Standard Concepts do not adequately represent the source detail for the Procedure necessary for a given analytic use subject. Consider using PROCEDURE_CONCEPT_ID instead to enable standardized analytics that can be consistent across the network. If the PROCEDURE_SOURCE_VALUE is coded in the source data using an OMOP supported vocabulary put the concept id representing the source value here.

properties.name: procedure_source_value
properties.description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the procedure that occurred. For example, this could be an CPT4 or OPCS4 code. Use this value to look up the source concept id and then map the source concept id to a standard concept id.

properties.name: procedure_type_concept_id
properties.description: This field can be used to determine the provenance of the Procedure record, as in whether the procedure was from an EHR system, insurance claim, registry, or other sources. Choose the PROCEDURE_TYPE_CONCEPT_ID that best represents the provenance of the record, for example whether it came from an EHR record or billing claim. If a procedure is recorded as an EHR encounter, the PROCEDURE_TYPE_CONCEPT would be 'EHR encounter record'. Accepted Concepts. A more detailed explanation of each Type Concept can be found on the vocabulary wiki.

properties.name: provider_id
properties.description: The provider associated with the procedure record, e.g. the provider who performed the Procedure. The ETL may need to make a choice as to which PROVIDER_ID to put here. Based on what is available this may or may not be different than the provider associated with the overall VISIT_OCCURRENCE record, for example the admitting vs attending physician on an EHR record.

properties.name: quantity
properties.description: If the quantity value is omitted, a single procedure is assumed. If a Procedure has a quantity of '0' in the source, this should default to '1' in the ETL. If there is a record in the source it can be assumed the exposure occurred at least once.

properties.name: site_id
properties.description: The care site ID.

properties.name: visit_id
properties.description: A foreign key to the visit in the VISIT table during which the device was used.

properties.name: condition.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'condition' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'procedure' table.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'procedure' table.

properties.name: procedure.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'procedure' table.

nodes.name: image_file

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: experimental_strategy
properties.description: The sequencing strategy used to generate the data file.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_phase
properties.description: The image file's data release Phase for a particular study.

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: file_url
properties.description: The URL of the file if it does not have a data GUID or object_id.

properties.name: image_quality
properties.description: Good, poor, or average image quality

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: object_ids
properties.description: The list of file identifiers (data GUIDs, DRS URIs, or URLs, etc.) for the imaging series, if applicable.

properties.name: series_instance_number
properties.description: order number for this image or other content.

properties.name: series_instance_uid
properties.description: Formal identifier for this image or other content.

properties.name: dataset.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'dataset' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'image_file' table.

properties.name: subject.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'image_file' table.

properties.name: imaging_series.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'imaging_series' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'image_file' table.

properties.name: imaging_study.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'imaging_study' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'image_file' table.

properties.name: image_file.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'image_file' table.

properties.name: base_caller_version

nodes.name: image_annotation
nodes.description: Files containing information describing characteristics of imaging studies, series and instances (e.g., segmentations, bounding boxes, feature labels) and inferences based on those characteristics (e.g., predicted diagnoses). Annotations may be recorded in the course of clinical care or retrospectively for purposes of research (e.g., imaging annotations from PACS or retrospective labeling tools). Please refer to https://midrc.org/annotations to learn more about a particular batch of annotations.

properties.name: airspace_disease_grading
properties.description: Values are extracted from the annotation file midrc_mdai_chestxr. Accepted values are "mild" opacities (1-2 lung zones), "moderate" opacities (3-4 lung zones), and "severe" opacities (>4 lung zones).

properties.name: annotation_long_name
properties.description: The long name of the annotation provides more information about the specific annotation.

properties.name: annotation_method
properties.description: Defines the method by which the annotation was created. Clinically_derived - Based on information produced in the process of the subject's medical care; Retrospective_expert - Based on information produced retrospective to the subject's care by annotators with relevant special clinical expertise; Retrospective_general - Based on information produced retrospective to the subject's care by annotators without relevant special clinical expertise; Retrospective_auto - Based on information produced retrospective to the subject's care using automated means.

properties.name: annotation_name
properties.description: The name of the annotation. These names are unique and assigned by MIDRC. Annotation names reference a document posted on the MIDRC website describing the annotation, methods and values expected. All MIDRC created annotations start with "midrc_".

properties.name: annotator_id
properties.description: Coded value to represent a particular annotator in a group. These need only be unique per annotation.

properties.name: class_covid19_pneumonia
properties.description: Values are extracted from the annotation file midrc_mdai_chestxr; Accepted values include "typical" appearance, which is multifocal bilateral, peripheral opacities, or opacities with rounded morphology, lower lung-predominant distribution;  "indeterminate" appearance, which is absence of typical findings and unilateral, central or upper lung predominant distribution of airspace disease; "atypical" appearance, which is pneumothorax or pleural effusion, pulmonary edema, lobar consolidation, solitary lung nodule, or mass diffuse tiny nodules cavity; "negative" for pneumonia, which is no lung opacities.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: instance_uids
properties.description: Used to denote that this annotation applies only to specific images (image instances) in a series.  When absent, the annotation when referencing an imaging series node applies to the entire imaging series.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: midrc_mRALE_score
properties.description: Values are extracted from the annotation file mRALE_Mastermind_Challenge. The Radiographic Assessment of Lung Edema (RALE) score is provided as a reference standard assessment of disease severity on chest radiograph.  A normal chest radiograph receives a score of 0, while a chest radiograph with complete consolidation of both lungs receives the maximum score of 24.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: object_ids
properties.description: The list of file identifiers (URLs, DRS URIs, or data GUIDs, etc.) for the file(s), if applicable.

properties.name: sift_image_quality_index
properties.description: A score of image quality based on the SIFT annotation software.

properties.name: software_version
properties.description: The version of the software being used to generate the annotations. For more information see https://midrc.org/annotations
